metadata.title: CVE-2017-8421 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The function coff_set_alignment_hook in coffcode.h in Binary FileDescriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.28,has a memory leak vulnerability which can cause memory exhaustion inobjdump via a crafted PE file. Additional validation indump_relocs_in_section in objdump.c can resolve this.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8421` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
binutils-multiarch - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
binutils-source - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
binutils-static - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: binutils package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5').
